item.headline: Week 1
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Activate prior knowledge of expressions.
  • Review quadratics and equations of circles.
  • Identify the features of a relation that make it a function.
  • Describe relations that are not functions.
  • Identify and use correct function notation.
  • Represent linear and quadratic functions with proper function notation. 
  • Explore the most common parent functions.
  • Compare parent functions using the main characteristics of their graphs.
  • Use visuals, including graphs, to determine the domain and range of functions.
  • Use tables of values and equations to determine the domain and range of functions algebraically.
  • Explore the concept of an inverse function.
  • Calculate inverse functions of common functions.
  • Identify transformations to basic parent functions.
  • Apply transformations to the equations of parent functions.
  • Apply a combination of transformations to basic parent functions.
  • Graph transformations of basic parent functions.

To-Do List:

Lessons:

  • Relations and Functions
  • Lesson Description

    • In this lesson, you will activate prior knowledge of expressions and graphing linear and quadratic relations. To complete this lesson, you should:

      • Complete the Relations and Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
    • Lesson 1.1 Mini-assessment
    • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
      Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
      Expectations: A1.2, A1.3, A1.8 and A1.9       
        • Complete the 1.1 Mini-assessment
        • Refer to your calendar for the due date.

  • Function Notation, Properties of Parent Function and Domain and Range of Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson you will learn what function notation is, and use it to represent linear and quadratic functions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Function Notation Lesson
      • Complete the Exploring Properties of Parent Functions Lesson
      • Complete the Determining the Domain and Range of Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • The Inverse Function
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson you will be introduced to the idea of the inverse function and investigate how to calculate the inverse of any function. To complete this lesson you should:
      • Complete the The Inverse Function Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Transformations of Parent Functions and Graphing
  • Lesson Descriptions
    • In this lesson you will learn how to identify transformations of the basic functions and describe them in proper mathematical language. You will also learn how to apply transformations to the equation of the parent function. To complete this lesson you should:
      • Complete the Transformations of Parent Functions Lesson
      • Complete the Graphing Transformations of Parent Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 2
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Review expanding and simplifying algebraic expression.
  • Review factoring polynomials.
  • Add and subtract binomial and trinomial expressions.
  • Simplify polynomial expressions.
  • Multiply and factor polynomial expressions.
  • Simplify rational expressions by factoring their numerators and denominators.
  • Identify restrictions on rational expressions.
  • Identify holes and asymptotes in graphs of rational functions. 
  • Graph rational functions.
  • Multiply and divide rational expressions.
  • Simplify rational expressions through factoring.
  • Add and subtract rational expressions.
  • Simplify rational expressions by finding common denominators.

To-Do List:

Lessons:

  • Getting Started and Adding and Subtracting Polynomials
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will activate prior knowledge of expanding, factoring, and simplifying polynomial expressions. To complete this lesson you should: 
      • Complete the Adding and Subtracting Polynomials Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
    • Please complete the Mini-assessment
    • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
      Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
      Expectations: A3.1
      • Complete the 2.1 Mini-assessment
      • Refer to your calendar for the due date. 

  • Multiplying and Factoring Polynomials
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to multiply and factor polynomial expressions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Multiplying and Factoring Polynomials Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Simplifying Rational Expressions and Graphs of Rational Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to simplify rational expressions by factoring their numerators and denominators, and you will identify restrictions. To complete this lesson, you should: 
      • Complete the Simplifying Rational Expressions Lesson
      • Complete the Graphs of Rational Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Multiplying and Dividing Rational Expressions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to multiply and divide rational expressions by multiplying their numerators and denominators, factoring, and simplifying. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Multiplying and Dividing Rational Expressions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Adding and Subtracting Rational Expressions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to add and subtract rational expressions by finding common denominators, factoring, and simplifying. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Adding and Subtracting Rational Expressions
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 3
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Review quadratic relations and their graphs.
  • Identify the vertex and axis of symmetry in quadratic graphs.
  • Determine the highest and lowest points of quadratic functions.
  • Identify an algorithm to find the vertex of a quadratic.
  • Explore the concept of the inverse of a function.
  • Graph the inverse of quadratic functions.
  • Simplify radical expressions.
  • Convert radicals to mixed numbers through factoring.
  • Solve quadratic equations in multiple ways.
  • Use strategies like factoring, completing the square, and using the quadratic formula to solve quadratics.
  • Classify quadratics into specific groups.
  • Identify characteristics that help you classify quadratics.
  • Solve problems involving the intersection of a linear and a quadratic function.

To-Do List:

Lessons:

  • Properties of Quadratic Relations and Determining Minimum and Maximum Values of Quadratics

  • Lesson Description

    • In this lesson you will review concepts of quadratic relations by looking at their graphs to identify their vertex and axis of symmetry. To complete this lesson, you should:

      • Complete the Properties of Quadratic Relations
      • Complete the Determining Minimum and Maximum Values of Quadratics Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
  • Please complete the Mini-assessment
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: A2.1, A2.2 and A2.3
    • Complete the 3.1 Mini-assessment
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date. 

  • The Inverse of a Quadratic Function and Operations with Radicals
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will determine the inverse of quadratic functions that are given in various forms. To complete this lesson, you should: 
      • Complete the The Inverse of a Quadratic Function Lesson
      • Complete the Operations with Radicals Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Solving Quadratic Equations
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review concepts from grade 10 by exploring multiple ways to solve quadratic equations, including factoring, completing the square, and using the quadratic formula. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Solving Quadratic Equations Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Families of Quadratic Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to write quadratic equations that share characteristics with given functions based on their form. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Families of Quadratic Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Linear-Quadratic Systems
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to solve a linear-quadratic system and identify if there are one, two, or zero solutions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Linear-Quadratic Systems
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 3 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review all of the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project and/or test. To complete this lesson you should:
      • Complete the Chapter Three Review and Activities
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 4
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Simplify exponents.
  • Explore patterns that model exponential growth.
  • Review integer exponent rules.
  • Simplify expressions involving integer exponents.
  • Simplify rational expressions.
  • Explore ways to simplify expressions with rational exponents.
  • Determine the key characteristics of exponential functions.
  • Compare linear, quadratic, and exponential functions.
  • Manipulate the parent exponential function graphically.
  • Apply transformations to the equations of exponential functions.
  • Solve real-world problems involving exponential growth and decay.
  • Use graphs and equations to solve problems.

To-Do List:

  • Exploring Growth and Decay and Working with Integer Exponents
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will activate prior knowledge of simplifying exponents and explore patterns that model exponential growth. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Exploring Growth and Decay Lesson
      • Complete the Working with Integer Exponents Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
  • Please complete the Assessment:
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: B1.3, B1.4, B2.1, B2.2, B2.3, B2.4, B2.5 and B3.2
    • Complete the MCR3U Checkpoint 1
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date.

  • Simplifying Rational Exponents
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn the rules for simplifying radical expressions (or expressions with rational exponents). To complete this lesson, you should: 
      • Complete the Simplifying Rational Exponents Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Exploring Properties of Exponential Functions and Transforming Exponential Functions (
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will compare linear, quadratic, and exponential functions to determine some of the key characteristics of exponential functions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Exploring Properties of Exponential Functions Lesson
      • Complete the Transforming Exponential Functions
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
  • Applications Involving Exponential Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will apply what you learned about exponential functions to solve real-world growth and decay problems. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Applications Involving Exponential Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 4 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review all of the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project and/or test. To complete this lesson you should:
      • Complete the Chapter 4 Review and Activities
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 5
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Review the Pythagorean Theorem.
  • Review the primary trigonometric ratios of right triangles.
  • Identify the reciprocal trigonometric identities.
  • Use the primary and reciprocal trigonometric identities to solve problems.
  • Explore trigonometric ratios of any angle.
  • Find the quadrants where trigonometric ratios are.
  • Explore trigonometric identities.
  • Simplify trigonometric expressions to prove trigonometric identities.
  • Review the Sine Law.
  • Solve real-world problems using the Sine Law.
  • Review the Cosine Law.
  • Solve real-world problems using the Cosine Law.
  • Solve three-dimensional problems using the Sine and Cosine laws.
  • Solve real-world problems involving angles and triangles.

To-Do List:

  • Getting Started and Trigonometric Ratios of Acute Angles
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson you will review concepts of quadratic relations by looking at their graphs to identify their vertex and axis of symmetry. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Getting Started Lesson
      • Complete the Trigonometric Ratios of Acute Angles Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
  • Please complete the Mini-assessment
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: D1.1, D1.2 and D1.3
    • Complete the 5.1-5.2 Mini-assessment
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date. 

  • Exploring Trigonometric Ratios of Any Angle
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will explore trigonometric ratios of any angle, including obtuse angles. You will examine the chapter circle to identify which quadrants each ratio is positive or negative in. To complete this lesson, you should: 
      • Complete the Exploring Trigonometric Ratios of Any Angle Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Trigonometric Identities
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will explore trigonometric identities and learn how to simplify trigonometric expressions to prove those identities. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Trigonometric Identities Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • The Sine Law and Cosine Law
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review the Sine Law and use it to solve real-world problems in two dimensions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the The Sine Law Lesson
      • Complete the The Cosine Law Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Solving 3D Problems Using Trigonometry
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will use the knowledge learned in this chapter to solve real-world problems in three dimensions, including problems involving bearings and angles of elevation and depression. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Solving 3D Problems Using Trigonometry Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 5 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review all of the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project and/or test. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Chapter 5 Review and Activities
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 6
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Explore relations that appear to repeat at regular intervals.
  • Graph relations that appear to repeat at regular intervals.
  • Graph the parent sine and cosine functions.
  • Determine the amplitude and period of the parent sine and cosine functions.
  • Identify the domain and range of sinusoidal functions.
  • Use the amplitude and period of functions to determine the characteristics of their graphs.

To-Do List:

  • Exploring Periodic Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will explore situations that have a table of values or graphs that repeat at regular intervals. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Exploring Periodic Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.
  • Please complete the Mini-assessment
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: C2.1
    • Complete the 6.1 Mini-assessment
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date. 

  • Investigating the Properties of Sinusoidal Functions and Interpreting Sinusoidal Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will graph the basic sine and cosine functions in degrees and use the graphs to determine the amplitude and period of these basic functions. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the  Investigating the Properties of Sinusoidal Functions Lesson
      • Complete the Interpreting Sinusoidal Functions Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 7
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Identify transformations of sinusoidal functions.
  • Define transformations of sine and cosine functions.
  • Use transformations to graph sine and cosine functions.
  • Analyze the graphs and tables of values of sinusoidal functions.
  • Write the equations for sinusoidal functions.
  • Solve real-world problems involving sinusoidal functions.

To-Do List:

  • Exploring Transformations of Sinusoidal Functions and Graphing Transformations of Sinusoidal Functions
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will examine the graphs of transformed sine and cosine functions to identify the transformations. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Exploring Transformations of Sinusoidal Functions Lesson
      • Complete the Graphing Transformations of Sinusoidal Functions Lesson 
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Investigating Models of Sinusoidal Functions and Solving Problems Using Sinusoidal Models
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to write equations for sine and cosine functions by analyzing their graphs and tables of values. To complete this lesson, you should:
        • Complete the Investigating Models of Sinusoidal Functions Lesson
        • Complete the Solving Problems Using Sinusoidal Models Lesson
        • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
        • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 6 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project or test. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Chapter 6 Review
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Please complete the Chapter 4-6 Summative Assessment
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: B1.1, B1.2, B1.3,B1.4, D1.1, D1.2, D1.3, D1.4, D1.5, D1.6, D1.7    D2.1, D2.2, D2.3, D2.4, D2.5, D2,6, D2.7, D2.8
    • Complete the Chapter 4-6 Summative
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date.

item.headline: Week 8
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Explore linear patterns.
  • Develop a formula for arithmetic sequences.
  • Explore non-linear patterns.
  • Determine a formula for geometric sequences.
  • Explore patterns that are neither arithmetic nor geometric.
  • Determine ways to solve recursive sequences.

To-Do List:

  • Arithmetic Sequences and Geometric Sequence
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will be introduced to linear patterns and the formula for arithmetic sequences. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Arithmetic Sequences Lesson
      • Complete the Geometric Sequences Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Recursive Sequences 
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will be introduced to patterns that cannot be solved with the formulas for arithmetic or geometric sequences because each term depends on the previous term. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Recursive Sequences Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Please complete the Checkpoint 2 Assessment
  • Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning
    Method of Assessment: KTCA Out Of
    Expectations: C1.1, C1.2, C1.3, C1.4, C1.5, C1.6, C2.1, C2.2, C2.3, C2.4
    • Complete the MCR3U Checkpoint 2
    • Refer to your calendar for the due date.

item.headline: Week 9
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Explore the sum of an arithmetic series.
  • Determine an equation for arithmetic series.
  • Explore the sum of a geometric series.
  • Determine the equation for calculating the sum of a geometric series.
  • Connect Pascal’s Triangle to the series.
  • Use Pascal’s Triangle to solve binomial expansion quickly.

To-Do List:

  • Arithmetic Series and Geometric Series
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to find the sum of an arithmetic sequence and be introduced to the formula for arithmetic series.To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Arithmetic Series Lesson
      • Complete the Geometric Series Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Pascal’s Triangle and Binomial Expansion
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will be introduced to Pascal’s Triangle and learn how to use it to quickly expand high-order binomials. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Pascal’s Triangle and Binomial Expansion Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 7 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review all the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project and test. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Chapter 7 Review and Activities
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 10
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Use the simple interest formula to calculate an investment's future value.
  • Determine the principal needed to have a certain amount in the future.
  • Explore the idea of compound interest.
  • Use the formula for compound interest to solve problems.
  • Manipulate the compound interest formula to find the present value.
  • Solve real-world compound interest problems.
  • Explore the idea of an annuity.
  • Calculate the future value of an annuity.

To-Do List:

  • Simple Interest and Compound Interest
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn about simple interest and how to use the formula to calculate the future value of an investment or the principal needed to invest in order to ensure a desired future value where interest is collected once a year on the original principal. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Simple Interest Lesson
      • Complete the Compound Interest - Future Value Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Compound Interest - Present Value
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn about compound interest and use the formula to find the present value of a loan or an investment based on the interest rate, compounding periods, and future value. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Compound Interest - Present Value Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Annuities - Future Value
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will be introduced to the idea of an annuity and learn how to calculate the future value of annuities. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Annuities - Future Value
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 11
item.content:
This week, you will:

  • Calculate the present value of an annuity.
  • Determine favourable compounding periods and interest rates for annuities.
  • Use spreadsheet software to analyze annuities.
  • Change parameters of annuities to offer quick analysis.

To-Do List:

  • Annuities - Present Value
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn how to calculate the present value of an annuity based on the interest rate, compounding periods, and future value of the annuity. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Annuities - Present Value Lesson
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Using Technology to Investigate Financial Problems
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will learn to use spreadsheet software to analyze annuities and examine how changing the parameters will affect the term and overall interest paid. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Using Technology to Investigate Financial Problems
      • Make sure to respond to all of the student prompts.
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

  • Chapter 8 Review
  • Lesson Description
    • In this lesson, you will review all the concepts learned in this chapter and prepare for a chapter project and test. To complete this lesson, you should:
      • Complete the Chapter 8 Review and Activities
      • Answer all the activities for the lesson.

item.headline: Week 12 - Final Exam
item.content:
Final Exam

You will have three hours to complete your final exam. You will be accomodated according to your IEP if applicable (extra time, formula sheet provided, etc.). Good luck!
